Reviews.Title: “Top little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Phromily
Reviews.Content: We (couple 61/61) stayed here for a week late March. Found this hotel through Trip Advisor comments. We were not disappointed. This is a great little hotel. Hotel management were very helpfull. Service overall was great. Rooms spacious, clean, well laid out, good bathroom and serviced daily. Tip: Ask for room (non-smoking) on a top floor. We were on the 5th floor. Reason being you can sometimes hear the Metro underground as it goes under the hotel. Not enough noise to disturb your sleep though! We found the hotel ran its air conditioning / heating on the 'hotter' side. At night we turned the heater temp. down in our room but it made no difference. No problem though, we just openned a bedroom window and let the fresh air in. If req'd the hotel internet is 5E for 15mins. Took us awhile to get familiar with the French format keyboard!. We did not eat at the hotel. Tip: There are three little restaurant's just across the road from the Hotel front door. Recommend the middle one, very reasonable prices, meals great. We did breakfast on the run each moring. There are hundreds of little coffee cafe's around there. Hotel very central to everything. Metro only 50 metres away. Galeries Lafayette shops and Opera 10 mins walk. Lourve and Monet museums 10-15mins walk through the Jardin des Tuileries . River 10mins. Notre Dame and Latin Quarter 15mins walk. We metro'd to the Champs-Elysées for shopping and did an easy stroll back (30mins). Tip: Depending on how long you are in Paris buy a Metro Travel Pass for 2,3 or 5 days. It will pay for itself the first day. I recall the 5 day Metro Travel Pass was 45E. You can easy get it at any Metro station direct from a ticket machine. The Metro goes everywhere and is very easy to use. Get a Metro map off the internet before you go. The metro trains run every couple of minutes. Metro out to see the Sacré-Coeur Basilica and surrounding area full of artisits (get off at Pigelle Metro). It's near the Moulin Rouge nightclub area. Also check out the Canal St-Martin area. It's worth a look to get off the tourist trail. The Eiffel Tower and Hôtel des Invalides (Emperor Napoleon's Tomb and what's got to be the best Army museum in Europe) should not be missed. Unless you plan to do 'a lot' of museum's we cannot recommend the Museum Pass (its rather expensive). We'd been to Paris before so wanted to do something different so we did the 'Tour Under (i.e. underground) the Effiel Tower' and the Roland Garros tennis stadium tour. Reservations are required for the Roland Garros tour. Book direct with the stadium. We did by email. Both very interesting. You tour right into the players rooms, etc. We also booked a 'tour' to have dinner in one of the Effiel Tower restaurants and then a River cruise. Tip: Book and take yourself to the Tower for dinner and cruise. The 'Tour' consisted of going to meet the bus, the bus then drove about 3 km to the Tower, a guide took us up to the restaurant, got us seated at our table, gave us the tickets for the cruise, pointed out where to catch the boat and then left! The restaurant was nice, average 3 course fixed meal and a bottle of average red between 4. We were sitting on tables of 8. Did'nt matter where you sat you still got a good view. The restaurant was only half full. I'm advised there is normally no trouble getting in on non-public holidays. After dinner we walked from the Tower over to the River (5mins) to catch the boat. No priority here. Just lined up with 200 other people to get on the boat and did the 'public' cruise. The cruise itself was fine. The 'tour' did not include return travel to your hotel so on return of the cruise we just Metro'd back to the hotel. In all we's classify the 'tour' as a 'rip off'. If you have not been to Paris before take your walking shoes. Paris is a city you can easy walk around. Once we'd Metro'd somewhere we just walked everywhere. Get some good walking maps like the ones in the Frommers Paris guide. We did and really enjoyed just 'touring' by ourselves off the tourist track. The only big tour we did this time was a day trip to view the abbey of Mont St-Michel on the Normandy coast. Its a 14 hrs round trip but worth every minute of it once you get there. It's a 'bucket list' item you must tick off. Back on the hotel: We loved it and will stay there again on our return to Paris late 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Well run, good location”
Reviews.Author: dsdvn
Reviews.Content: Clean, well sound-proofed, recently refurbished, spacious, welcoming. Breakfast room is historic but rather small. Well situated for serious spending.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall”
Reviews.Author: VeraSh
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had were very satisfied with this hotel. Perfect location, close to all places of interest, so we could walk to most place with our kids. Hotel personell and management is very responsive and proactive. We stayed in a room for 3 people and it was very spacious and had a view on Madleine. In my 3 nights at the hotel, I did not have a single complaint. Just perfect all around.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Miki D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon here, my second trip to Paris, his first. The location was perfect 2 metro stations within 2 blocks!! We found the hotel clean, the service very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family stay!”
Reviews.Author: dinulik
Reviews.Content: we've stayed at this hotel with our almost three year old daughter. Upon arrirval we've been informed that our triple room has been upgrdaded to a terrific two room suite with a huge bathroom (bathtub and shower), separate toilet... The concierge at the front desk has told us as we've first walked through the doors that "we are here for you!" and this is exactly the athmosphere in this hotel. Our room was cleaned twice a day, in the evening the lights in the bedroom were on, our daughter would get a sweet surprise on her pillow and we'd get Godiva chocolates every night... The location is very centrsl and you can walk everywhere by foot ( this is why we've chose this hotel), however the area offers much more shoppping rather than good food, especiallly for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Opera Garnier,Musée D'Orsay,Le Louvre”
Reviews.Author: brigherr
Reviews.Content: Ideally located,5min. to Metro Station "Madeleine" and 15 min. Walk to Opera Garnier,20 min Walk to Musée d'Orsay. Excellent Relation Price/value. Perfect for a short visit. We greatly appreciated the friendly ,helpfull staff. We were given a quiet room on the 5th floor with beamed ceiling and bathtub and could check in early,around noon. The room was very clean .Will come back,for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, modest, but great location”
Reviews.Author: CuriousSerbia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only night in December 2011 and did not even had a chance to have breakfast, as I was late to a meeting. My room was on the second floor, looking over the street, which was a bit noisy. The room was small and furniture was modest, but everything was clean and the bed was comfortable. Was OK for my one night stay. WiFi was running smoothly and that was all I needed. The location was great, so I could have a walk in the evening and see Place Vendome, Obelisk, Louvre (only from the outside :-(, Madeleine church, Eiffel tower in the distance, etc. I would recommend it, as it was decent and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Beth56
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights there while in Paris to shop the January sales. Fabulous location once I finally found it! Two very close Metro stops and only one block from Rue de Faubourg. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. The standard room was a nice comfortable size, well-appointed, and the bed/pillows very comfortable. The property was clean and The elevator modern and reliable. Having a robe and slippers in the closet and a towel warmer in the bathroom was lovely! I will definitely stay here again on return trips.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kaveriHelsinki
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in an excellent location. The hotel is also very suitable for families, family suites are excellent; excellent beds and exceptionally clean bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: janeol123
Reviews.Content: Booked for two nights over New Year (including NYE). Had booked a family room via ebookers.com but was upgraded due to a coincidental double booking. We were given 2 interconnecting rooms (56 & 57) instead and we're really delighted with the size and comfort. Excellent beds in both rooms and exceptionally clean bathrooms. Very quiet at night time too although I am not surprised the streets were so quiet on 31st and 1st as New Year's Eve was basically cancelled in Paris! No fireworks whatsoever and shops all boarded up on the Champs Elysee at 6/7pm. Huge disappointment but I digress. The metro was only a soothing distant rumble and did not cause us any issues with sleeping. Breakfast was good with a nice array of choices. However, the hot food only consisted of sausages and very dry scrambled egg. This needs attention as does the number of tables in the small breakfast area. There are too many and it is therefore very cramped. There are plenty of good places to grab breakfast though round the corner from the hotel. Excellent free wi-fi access and lovely staff. Gripes: hot breakfast choices, only 2/3 English speaking TV channels. Expensive mini-bar. Booking did say we were supposed to have a Nespresso machine in the room but there wasn't and the air-conditioning was not working so we just opened the window and yes we had the window open all night and noise still was not an issue. Would definitely recommend for families and couples especially due to the amazing location. Thank you Best Western!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: nic1954
Reviews.Content: Our company has a list of hotels in each city that we can choose from. Based on the Trip Advsor reviews as well as the fact that it was one of the cheaper hotels on the company list, I chose the Best Western Opera. What a good decision! The location was perfect for absolutely everything - museums, galleries, shopping, the Metro, the RER, Airport Bus, the Opera Garnier, the Christmas Markets you name it. Every single one of the staff was super friendly - thank you Annie for your especially warm welcome after arriving off a 13 hour flight. Nothing was too much trouble for them to sort out. I stayed on the third floor - a small but comfortable room with no noise whatsoever. When on business a good breakfast and free wi-fi are essential - this hotel has both. My only gripe as someone else noted was the heat control in the room. I eventually just turned the heater off as the room was warm enough without it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and accessibility”
Reviews.Author: taxman53
Reviews.Content: Took the Metro in from CDG to the Madeline stop and when we came up the elevator with our luggage, we were about 100 yards from the OR. Later, found a Metro entrance that was much closer. We got a deluxe room #57, fifth floor. Lots of room. The bed was firm but comfortable. The subway noise that has been mentioned in previous posts was a non issue, sounding like an occasional distant rumble of thunder. The bathroom was great and very spacious. TV only has two english speaking stations (BBC and CNN), but you should not spend much time in your room in Paris, right? The folks at the desk were very helpful with recommendations and helping to make reservations at restaurants when needed, as well as advice on the metro. Umbrellas were available to borrow if needed. We did not have the breakfast there so cannot comment on that. Bad things? There wasn't a lot of storage space to unpack your clothes on to shelves in the closet, and there was no dresser drawers. Also, we had some problems with the heat in the room and did not discover how to adjust the heat radiating from a heat panel in the room until a few days into the visit. Also, there is construction going on in a building behind the hotel, and that will wake you up somewhere around 730 AM.... none of these things are deal breakers or should keep you from staying here. English is spoken easily by all the staff we met. If you want a comfortable small hotel that is within easy walking distance to museums, shopping and the Metro, this is your place. Price was a pretty good value compared to other hotels with this kind of location

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: karenosh
Reviews.Content: I was staying with a friend in Paris and decided that I should move to a hotel, I found this hotel on TripAdvisor and within half an hour I was on my way to the Hotel. I was greeted with such friendliness and when it was found out that I had just made the reservation, I said yes, I hope you have a nice room for me and he said I do but I am going to upgrade you to a suite! That kindness was just what I needed to make the best ending of my trip to Paris Perfect! Location is wonderful walking distance to all the shopping and easy to get a bus or metro. Annie was wonderful printing out some papers that I needed to sign and then scanning them back to my Email. The rooms are so clean and the breakfast is perfect. The staff is very helpful and friendly and I would definitely return. Oh and I had a King size bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,excelent staff,fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeCon75
Reviews.Content: I first booked this hotel because of its location which is absolutely the best.I was though surprised by the service.The moment you enter the hotel you feel like coming to a friends house.Everybody makes you feel comfortable and they try to offer the best assistance.The rooms are very good and the breakfast room cozy and simple.This hotel is the major reason that i enjoyed my time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a convenient location to the Best of Paris”
Reviews.Author: akaschultz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is without any doubt well worth it's 4 star rating. The rooms are nice, the service is excellent as is their facilities. They have a fantastic Continental Breakfast that is reasonable. Their location is within walking distance to Place de la Concorde. the Tuillery Gardens, the church of La Madeleine, the Bateaux Mouches (siteseeing boats) as well as a short bus ride to Notre Dame Cathedral and the Louvre. In addition, there are two different Metro lines nearby with connection to the RER C line to Versailles. And finally there is a wide variety of shops, restaurants, brasseries and sidewalk cafes many of which we took advantage of. One final note: the Hotel staff went out of their way to offer any assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Really a nice hotel reasonable and cant beat the location!!!”
Reviews.Author: watson80
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed out staying this Aug, 2011. Streets were not too busy which was great!! very nice and clean rooms (except for the 1st floor) with updated modern bathrooms. Nice size rooms i expected smaller:-) friendly stuff. The only bad recommendation from the hotel stuff we had when we had to go to the airport and they offered us a shuttle for 2 people that would come out to 60 euros??? from a russian girl at the desk. Taxi is about 50-60 dollars usually and its august!!!! so our taxi came out to 45 euros. We did not eat at their restaurant b/c there are so many places around! great walking distance to museums restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JB-KT
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. Close to many sites as well as 2 metro stops. Easy walk to Tuleries Garden, Louvre, Opera, and more. We walked to Notre Dame and Arc de Triomphe but that might be too far for some. Stayed in a Superior Room and found it perfect for our needs - not very big but certainly not too small. The rooms were very quiet too. There was a little road work going on outside but you couldn't tell with the windows closed. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We chose to eat out rather than eating breakfast in the hotel. If you're looking for an affordable hotel that is clean, comfortable and close to all the main sites in central Paris, this is a great option!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: billthoo
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here, and it has been consistently good. This time we stayed in a deluxe room, instead of having the breakfast option. The internet rate is substantially (!!!) lower than the rack rate. The room was more spacious and overlooked the Eglise Madeleine. The double glazing keeps most of the noise out. It's just too noisy most of the time to open the windows. We could hear the rumble of the metro when it was quiet, but these slight noises don't trouble us. The only issue that might cause light sleepers a problem is that the street lamp sits directly outside the second floor windows and casts a bright orange halogen glow into the room unless the curtains a firmly closed. The service was again wonderful and in English, for us poor monoglots. The location is perfect! Two blocks from Place de Concorde. One block from Eglise Madeleine and the metro there. Three blocks from Opera. 4 blocks from Printemp and Galleries La Fayette. 15 minutes walk from the Louvre. 30 minutes walk from Notre Dame and the Arc de Triomphe. I only the weather was warmer this July and it would have been completely magical. We didn't make use of room service or the breakfast service this trip. We did book a shuttle from the airport that did not show up, but this is not a hotel issue. The cost of the taxi from Charles de Gaule was about the same as the shuttle in the end. Definitely recommend a stay here if you want to walk to all the sights, and particularly the shopping. We may stay somewhere over in the left bank and Latin Quarter next time, but only for something a little different. Otherwise, we will be back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a family to see Paris”
Reviews.Author: Piujuq
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite on the top floor. The rooms were excellent and roomy with sloped ceilings. Nice touch to look over the roof tops and gaze into the heart of Paris. Breakfast was excellent and of great value compared to what you would pay on the street. Staff was excellent and great for asking advice on places to eat, river cruises to use and buses to use to see the city with limited time. We stayed for 4 days and hotel and staff flawless. Hat goes off to staff.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, very good service, we'd do it again”
Reviews.Author: poolemeister
Reviews.Content: The best thing I can say about this hotel is that it was everything we need in a hotel. We are not "hotel people", so when we go on holiday we're not spending a lot of time in the hotel - so we look for a clean room, comfortable bed (I'm 6'2"), modern amenities, and friendly people. The Opera Richepanse was all of the above. The hotel is located in a fabulous part of Paris near to many attractions, shops, and fantastic dining. The hotel staff was very helpful and accomodating, able to suggest great transportation, dining and interesting things to do. About the only negative I would say about the room was that the bathroom was small for me. The rest of the stay was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Macree74
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on booking.com at a great rate for the Madeleine suite on the top floor. It appeared to be half the published price for that suite. Fabulous with a small balcony and roof top view. The suite was very spacious and well appointed. Staff generally very helpful, but Marie the receptionist on our first few days there was most friendly and kind. She directed us to a great restaurant around the corner - Vin Choi(?) Moi - a delightful bistro with wonderful food. There are many great locations in Paris, but we found this to be most suitable for us, close to theTuileries and the Madeleine. Breakfast was fine and typical of European breakfasts, but would have to agree that the space was small if everyone comes to breakfast at the same time! It is not inexpensive but then nothing was in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, Great stuff, cozy room!”
Reviews.Author: SayuriH
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and had a fabulous time there. The staffs were very friendly and helpful. The location was unbeatable, very close to the metro, and all major attractions were within walking distance. And if you love shopping, you definately should consider this hotel, it is very close to the flagship stores of many luxury brands, whilst the price is so much lower than other hotels in the same district. The room was big for European standard. It had all the amenities that we needed in the room. It was also very clean. The only downside was probabily the noise and the vibration from the metro. We could feel the vibration but it did not bother us and the noise did not wake us up from our sleeps. We were on the third floor in room 35, probabily one of the rooms that were closer to the metro, so as for other rooms, I would assume the noise would be less. Overall, we were very happy with this hotel and would highly recommended to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS STAY, WOULD RECOMMEND!!!”
Reviews.Author: 155013Wendy
Reviews.Content: I met my 20 year old daughter in Paris on her break from school. The hotel was perfectly located. close to all major attractions. hotel was impeccably clean - staff was friendly and helpful! I used trip advisor to help me to chose this hotel, and therefore felt compelled to share my positive experience. DEFINATLY RECOMMEND TO ANYONE!!!!!! 10 OUT OF 10!!!! the perfect place to enjoy paris at a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel special”
Reviews.Author: Michelle186340
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel twice now, we stayed in a VIP room on both occasions which was lovely. The hotel is very clean and the room is spacious. The staff are very friendly and really do make you feel special. The hotel has bathrobes and slippers which is a nice touch. The location is also perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Le Bristol”
Reviews.Author: notsolomon9
Reviews.Content: The best hotel by location and view from window #402 . Quiet streets, but little bit noise from other rooms. Our vip room were big. Service were very very good and friendly.Breakfast were appetit! Reception girl was very spoke russian! But! matrasse is very hard !

Reviews.Title: “PROFESSIONAL”
Reviews.Author: TravelreporterSA
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in perfect location. Worth it. An art deco delight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Lotta1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Nice located hotel, but not too many restaurants and cafe nearby. Would recommend having breakfast at the hotel? Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Sear
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, room not so large but with nice newly done bathroom. This is an old building with beams across the ceiling. The location is good, maybe 5 mins walk from the Louvre and near the Madeleine metro station. The restaurant just opposite is good but not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Professional and extremely friendly service”
Reviews.Author: AlbertTeixeiraNdunda
Reviews.Content: I stayed at your hotel with my fiance and her twin sister. We had two rooms booked. Upon arrival we were met with friendly smiles and attitudes. During our stay we were surprised by how much the staff really engaged with us. Being first time in Paris, we were directed to the city attractions with ease. A special thanks goes to Justine and Annie for their unreserved commitments. Even though the breakfast area is quite small, it provided for a cozy atmosphere. We had an experience of a lifetime. We cannot wait to stay at your hotel very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, super friendly staff, awsome location!”
Reviews.Author: Omerabr
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in May for 6 days with my GF. First, the room was HUGE in terms of european hotels* , comfy bed and specious bath. the hotel is 10 minutes away from Medeleine/Concord subway, also close to Rue de Rivoli st and Champs elysee. In front of the hotels there are two fabulous brasseries, with good (expensive) food, we eat breakfest there but if you go around you will find plenty of good brasseries as well. The staff was awsome! the aircondition wasn't cooling those days of the year (hotel policy) so the guy from the front desk set me a portable air condition which did the work for me. overall good hotel, great service close to many good places. will defiantly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & location, except for the metro!”
Reviews.Author: Alfa_Vic
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel! We stayed 4 nights and enjoyed the ambience and the locality of the hotel. Some travel websites only indicate this hotel as 3 stars, but 4 stars is more on the mark. Good value for a Paris hotel. The next time I stay there, I will definately request a room higher up in the building so as to avoid the underground metro rumble! Luckily the metro stops around 11pm so did not affect us that much.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: JamesInParis2010
Reviews.Content: We had a three night reservation for a family suite. The suite was beautiful and clean. We had a balcony overlooking the street below. It was fun to sip coffee and tea on the balcony while watching the bustling street below. The location is close to many attractions, restaurants and bars. Yes, as other reviewers have written, the nearby food and beverage can be a little pricey, but what we expected prior to our arrival. This hotel has great character, with each room unique. The building is a real gem and so solid that not a peep of noise could be heard from nearby rooms. Even hallway noise was at a minimum. The staff, especially the manager, were so friendly and helpful that it made our stay much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location but...”
Reviews.Author: janvg1
Reviews.Content: this is a very good hotel , but absolutely no Wow factor. Very clean hotel rooms !! missing: place to have a drink or just sit down ; the lobby is very small. BEWARE: don't take a room on first floor !!!!!! you will feel the metro !!! I assume that a room a couple of floors higher would be ok. On first floor you will also hear a lot of streetnoise. overall ok hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would happily stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: deb31610
Reviews.Content: As we only had 2 nights in Paris, I chose this hotel for its central location. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was lovely. We were there on week nights, but the room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up to All of My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: JFsB
Reviews.Content: This small, friendly, comfortable hotel is a tremendous find in the 1st arrondissement. Booked a VIP room (#14), which was quite comfortable with a king-size bed, small table with 2 chairs, loveseat, flat panel TV, mini bar, and charming bathroom. The room size was much, much larger than anticipated, considering its in-city location. Arrived several hours in advance of the check in time, but, luckily, the room was ready, and check in was a breeze. Overall, the hotel and room were well maintained (although I was taken back by the number of stains on the carpet in the room, as they do allow small pets), and were tastefully decorated in art nouveau style. As others have reported, the street noise can be a bit much, but just pop in some ear plugs, and you'll have a good night's sleep. Because of the hotel's extremely convenient location -- a mere 10-minute walk from the Louvre and the Batobus stop (highly recommend the multi-day pass so you can hop on / hop off at any of their eight, conveniently located docks near all the big attractions along the Seine) -- it is a great "home base" from which to explore all of Paris. In fact, because of this location, I was able to visit the Louvre, Musee de l'Orangerie, Ile de la Cite / Notre Dame, the Bastile, Place de Vogues, Statue de la Liberty, Tour Eiffell, Musee d'Orsay, Musee Rodin, Invalides, Musee de l'Armee and the Petit & Grand Palais in 3 days! The staff - especially Annie and Jeremy - couldn't be more professional, courteous, helpful or friendly: where else would room service staff bring you a chocolate Easter bunny when they brought your requested bucket of ice?

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: MaineIzzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed six nights in VIP room #57. The beginning of the stay was bumpy: I'd reserved a non-smoking room and called 10 days in advance to confirm all details. The nice lady even said they'd have room made up early for us b/c our flight arrived so early (6:30 am, putting us at hotel around 9:30am). When we arrived, the room was not to be ready until 2pm, normal check-in time. We did the jet-lag-walk-around and I rested in lobby until room was ready. Unfortunately, the room was a smoking room. The smell was intense and the product used to mask the smell almost as bad. After being told we could not switch rooms, we moved to a much nicer room. It was huge (for Paris) and faced a quiet side (we gave up a modest view of Madeleine church that we had from smoking room). The bathroom was very nice and big. Despite not getting much direct sun, the room was fairly light because of its large floor-to-ceiling windows that open. Coffee pot in room and we used mini fridge for our own goodies. Grocery store close by. Easy walk to Louvre, Metro, Concorde, Orsay and much more. The bed was hard, but that seems to be the way of Europe. Towel warmer in bathroom was nice touch and helpful for the little sink laundry we did. The shopping is very expensive in the area - lots of luxury chains. Myriad cafes in the area - tho those near hotel are way overpriced, beware. The staff was so helpful throughout our stay, especially Jeremy.

Reviews.Title: “"Lovely Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: cordy3
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this beautiful hotel. Arrived late and where so impressed with warmness of staff. Throughout they were extremely helpful and courteous. We had booked two rooms and were given two adjajent rooms on first floor. They were spotless and overlooked the street. The noise was slightly raised on Saturday due to revellers, but that is to be expected in a city. Really loved the ambience of this hotel, it is a real jewel. I wouldnt, hesitate to return to this hotel.......

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishSailor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights recently with my husband. There is very little I could fault it on. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The room was small but spotless, with a turndown service every night. The location is excellent- 5 or 10 minutes walk from the main attractions (Louvre, Place de la Concorde, Champs Elysee) and 2 minutes from the metro. The hotel has great character- a refreshing change from impersonal and homogenous hotel rooms. Beware the prices in bars and restaurants nearby however- we had a drink in the bar next door and felt severely ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: pxb123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. Service at the hotel was exceptional. I really enjoyed my stay here, relatively central and close to everything. Room was very nice. It is a bit noisy though (metro and street noise).

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: h2a
Reviews.Content: staff friendly, very good location close to Madeleine, 3 bed in room, close to restaurants, mgasins, champ elisee, bad in the price + expensive about 250 Euros per day 3 persons

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: DawnJOhannesburg
Reviews.Content: Within easy walking distance of the metro, main shopping street, and Place de la Concorde and Seine.. Very, very noisy - Looks onto a street where youngster come out of a nightclub on Saturday nights and stand around screaming and shouting until 6:am Sunday morning. Decor in rooms is a bit outdated - they could do with a bit of modernisation.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: horse1uk
Reviews.Content: Great little privately owned hotel under the Best Western flag, brilliantly centrally located within walking distance of nearly all the attractions and with great metro stations just outside the door Concorde & Madeline lots of good resturants cafe's in the vacinity. I would recomend the cafe on the end of the street at the end of the hotel and Marmite brasserie near the Pigelle metro nr the moulin rouge. The rooms were cleaned daily and made up daily to a very good standard all the hotel staff were friendly and courteous, good value for money in Paris. Very small downside you could hear the faint sound of metro beneath especially in the night when its quite, didnt effect our stay at all just made us laugh in no way would it prevent us from returning. RECOMENDED

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: northsoutheastwest
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at this great little hotel. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a suite, with comfortable beds and a large bathroom with shower and separate tub. The art deco ffurnishings are a nice touch and the housekeeping services are top notch. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. As everybody else has mentioned the location is fantastic, close to many attractions like the Louvre and and the Tillorie Gardens and an easy metro ride to others from two nearby stations.. This gem of a hotel on a short little stree off Rue Honore is a great deal in a city where good prices are few and far between. I highly reccomend The Best Western Premier Opera Richepanse!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location, coupled with service, service, and service!”
Reviews.Author: billthoo
Reviews.Content: It's hard not to smile when thinking of a visit to Paris, and then having the luck to pick this hotel. It is within a 1 minute walk from Madeline Metro, and 5 minutes from Concorde Metro. The Madeleine church is a block away, Place de la Concorde and the Jardin Tuileries 5 minutes walk. And yet the street is quiet. What more could you want? Besides being 10-15 minutes walking distance to the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, the Champs Elysees, Lafayette and Printemp department stores, around the corner from theFauchon luxury food emporium and Laduree macaroon store, it is also just off Rue St. Honore with all it's designer labels and a short walk from Rue Vendome! Great during sales season, but dangerous at any other time. More practically there is a Monoprix convenience store just around the corner open till late, which also stocks sandwiches and tins of foie gras (unethical, yet so tasty...). The hotel staff was excellent, as everyone else has noted. We arrived after 24 hours of flying at 10am, and our rooms were already prepared (grateful, but unexpected). Check in and check out was easy. The desk staff helpful with maps and directions, and assistance to the airport. The breakfast staff were pleasant. All the desk staff spoke good English, which should rightly embarras all us monolinguals. The rooms were pretty standard, but a good place to sleep. Every now and then you did feel the rumble of a passing metro beneath the hotel, but it certainly didn't wake us from sleep or cause any disturbance. It was almost comforting to know that this hotel was not completely perfect! During humid weather the air conditioning was under powered, but the huge windows all opened to allow air in. The bathroom was of adequate size, and the shower had good water pressure. There was a standard room security safe. Although there were not enough free electrical sockets, there was a powerboard with universal (international) sockets. Breakfast was basic, but reasonably priced (for Paris), and offered reliably cooked and cold food and pastries. Omelettes and espresso coffee is included in the price, but on request. The food was certainly enough to keep us going most of the day. The cost was very reasonable. We would definitely stay there again. In the heart of Paris, great staff, great price. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Staff are fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mtraveller83
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, could not fault it. Best location in Paris, 2 minutes walk to most of Paris's attractions and monuments as well as a great sight seeing tour. Staff made the hotel the most memorable. They were so helpful during our entire stay and always had time to assist us. Rooms are beautiful and so clean. We didn't have a single issue during our whole time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: snne
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful Art Deco hotel located in a great location. The lobby and rooms were absolutely gorgeous! We had a triple (which is hard to find) and had plenty of space. The staff were very helpful and accomodating throughout our stay. We would definitely stay at this hotel again! There is a nearby metro stop as well as several restaurants. A word of warning though DO NOT go to the restaurant on the corner-Les Tres Quartiers-the very friendly waiter lured is in for an overpriced meal with terrible service. He basically lured people in and then "bullied" them into ordering more than what they wanted. We watched two familes leave because of this treatment. Since we were tired and hungry and had already ordered we were stuck. The food was ok but definitely not worth the price and treatment by this waiter. We did not see this anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: TishCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days in Paris with my daughter (age22). We wanted to find a resonably priced hotel in a safe area with a central location. This hotel was perfect. Our room was (on Paris standards) relatively large (room #51) with two twin beds. Room and bath was spotless! Easy access to two main metro stops. Easy walk to the Louve and Notre Dame. Staff extremely helpful with directions, reservations for dinner and taxis. We arrived late at night (after 11pm) and had no problem with check in . . .room ready for us with beds turned down. We did request a room upstairs because there is some noise from the Metro that runs below. We were on the 5th floor and found the noise not a problem at all. Did not eat breakfast at the hotel (too many great cafes nearby). However, if you are a tourist (specifically American) do not eat at the cafe next door to the hotel (BRASSERIE DES TROIS QUARTIERS). They were extremely rude to us. Only gave us one menu and never came and took our order. They snickered at us the entire time we were there. We finally had to leave. Really spoiled our afternoon. Stay away from that cafe! Other than we had a fabulous time and loved the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Break”
Reviews.Author: x_YoungCouple_x
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 day break in Paris, and miss it already!!! It was mine and my boyfriends first holiday together, and couldn't of been happier with our choice of hotel. We stayed in the V.I.P. suite and highly reccommend it to other travellers, it exceeded our expectations in size with a toilet and en-suite separate. Maid service was brilliant they came and tidied not only the routine once a day but every time we left (which we really appreciated as we managed to leave it in a tip!) The staff are really helpful and friendly, they reccommended good restaurants (we ate at the italian across the road, which was gorgeous!) also bars and clubs in the area.Unfortunantly we didn't take their advice on which clubs to go to and ended up going out near the arc de triomphe which is unbelievably expensive !! (as students we were shocked when we had to pay 40 euros for a vodka orange and beer!!) The staff also sorted out taxis for us but make sure you go down on time and don't wait until they call your room as taxis will start charging straight away as we normally were already on 10 euros when we got in.The hotel is in an ideal location for anyone who wants to go to Paris for sightseeing or shopping as we walked down to the champs elysees in 10 minutes, which is beautiful. As a young couple on our first holiday it was a perfect choice of location and we really enjoyed our stay and would go back. The only downside is that everything is expensive but that is what you will expect from being in the centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, very clean and well located. Lovely really.”
Reviews.Author: Purplestan
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. They were extremely friendly. The room was nice and so was the hotel. Our room smelled lovely and was so clean. We came back every night to find our bed turned down with chocolates - Godiva. Haven't had this in a few years - usually only with 5 star hotels. The only thing that was strange was that the shower door was on the wrong side of the bath so the floor got drenched when ever we showered. That may have just been our room and didn't effect us too much. The location was great. Right next to Madeleine Metro and a few mins walking distance of Concorde Metro. Short walk to Rue De Rivoli which leads to the Louvre and the Seine and the Jardin du Tuileries. On our first day there we walked from the hotel to all around the left bank and The Latin Quarter then walked back again - was a very pleasant walk. So 20 to 40 mins walk away depending on how fast you walk. Everything else is a short Metro ride away. Nice restaurants opposite the hotel and surrounded by middle to high end shops. Staff were extremely helpful without asking and even more so when asked.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Valletta054
Reviews.Content: The hotel is found just by the Madeleine .... thus a perfect location, with Madeliene metro on one side and concrode metro on the other, both less then 5 minutes. The reeception area is small, but the service is attentive to detail and friendly. The fact that it is a small intimate hotel, extreme few rooms, makes you feel a person, not just a number. When, you return at the hotel, they know whon you are, and at times, handle the key card without asking for the room number. Indeed, I arrived in the morning and obviously the room wasn't ready. However, when I returned in the afternoon, the luggage was already carried to my room. They just foward the key and told me the room number - fast & efficient service The room is quite big, and modern furniture. There is also a minibar. the only downfall is that it isn't sound prove. Thus, if you are on the lower floor, you might hear the sounds of the cars, and worse of the metro when it passes underneath the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Find!”
Reviews.Author: AlanVancouverBC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 10 days here in May 2008. The people, room, facilities and service were outstanding. The location is superb, right downtown and within a 15 minutes walk of all the "must-see" places and shopping, with two metro stations at either end of the short street on which this hotel is located. The bedrooms are spacious, comfortable and quiet at night. The people are extremely helpful, friendly and english is no problem. I'm recommending this hotel unreservedly!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice, clean, frinedly well run little hotel in Paris - Top Marks!”
Reviews.Author: Rex-Diver
Reviews.Content: My wife & I booked a VIP room at this hotel through Expedia for a short stay in Paris. The hotel is well located for seeing the major sights & only a short (10min) walk from The Louvre whilst being literally around the corner from Place de La Concorde & Madeleine Church. It is located down a somewhat fairly busy side street just around the corner from the Concorde Metro Station. The desk staff were absolutley first rate. Very friendly, spoke excellent English, very helpful & keen to help. The hotel is quite small & intimate (only 36 or so rooms) but the rooms are very large given normal Parisienne standards. Bathrooms & toilets were en-suite, quite small but well furnished. The room had a mini bar which was regularly stocked & reasonably priced given the cost of drinking in bars in Paris. If you want to stock your own food & drink in the mini fridge, then the hotel has no apparant problem with you doing this. The desk staff offered me a map & gave me advice about which Metro to catch to see the sights I wanted to - all without any prompting. In line with previous reviews, the Metro does indeed run underneath the hotel but this is no more than a faint rumble every 30 mins, so faint that the TV drowns it out. We were on the 2nd floor & were not bothered by it. The rooms have double glazed windows so traffic noise is kept out. The thick curtains prevent any street light from entering the room. The room had 2 lots of double French doors opening onto a small balcony overlooking the street. The rooms are a little tired but more importantly they are clean. The bed was large & comfortable with nice pillows, we had no problems sleeping. The restaurant across the street - The Royal Madaleine - is as good as any. Try the Onion Soup. It's served in a large bowl with lot's of croutons & topped with a thick layer of cheese. It's only a starter but is virtually a meal on it's own. Incidentally, I'm sure the hotel room service uses this restaurant as the menu is exactly the same items & price & we often saw the restaurant owner running across the road to the hotel with plates covered in foil. The rack rate at the hotel was 360 Euros - we paid half that amount. In truth I would have been disappointed had I paid the full amount but given the price we paid versus the general price of hotels in Paris I was more than satisfied. All in all, you could do a lot worse than choosing this hotel in Paris. I would stay there again & would recommend it as an excellent base for seeing the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: SEB12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our Christmas city break 2007. The hotel is in a great location. The rooms were comfortable, newly decorated and spotlessly clean. The hotel staff were very freindly and helpful (my French is rubbish so I'm always worried how that will be received!) Would, and have, recommended this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, big rooms for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: MontgomeryUK
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel with big rooms (in comparison to most Paris hotel rooms) - which was a welcome change for Paris! We requested a room high up as some reviews had said it was noisy and had no problems. Fabulous location within walking distance of most of the major sites and also some great shops also within a few minutes walk. Really friendly staff who were willing to help with anything including taxis, restaurant bookings etc. All in all a great stay and really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay here !”
Reviews.Author: Lisab
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best deal for the money in Paris ! Darling hotel, nice room, great bath, friendly/helpful staff and fantastic location !!! So close to soooo many sights ! And handy for little cafes, bars, deli s, ultra chic window shopping, pharmacy, etc.. I traveled alone and felt completely safe even at 11pm at night walking this area. Very close to tres expensive/classy hotels and their lounges and bars. Very close to Champs d Elysees and Louvre and Place de Concord, Opera, English book store. Staff all so helpful and had excellent English skills, but very nice about helping with my French. Would most definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best hotel's I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: iloveparis626
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Opera Richepanse was FABULOUS. This was my 4th time in Paris and this hotel went above and beyond my expectations. First of all this hotel is in a perfect location. It is down the street from all the best shopping anyone can do. It is close to the Champs-elysee and the Louvre. The Rooms where clean and spacious and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. My only recommendation is asking for a room on a high floor because the metro runs right underneath the hotel. Also I was reading some other reviews and people commented on the breakfast area being to small. Well, it is very small but you're in Paris, you should wake up early and stop at a bakery and have a croissant and coffee and then be on your way. Next time I'm in Paris this is where I will stay..

Reviews.Title: “What a deal”
Reviews.Author: jtriefen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the heart of Paris and what a deal. We booked about 4 months in advance and got a great deal. Very nice stay, big rooms, great service, wonderful breakfast, and in the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: traveling_minx
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the top floor suites (I think the Madeline?) For 4 nights during the last week in September 2006. We checked in a couple hours early, as we had to escape from our previous horrible hotel as soon as possible. To our surprise and delight, they had upgraded us from a superior room to their best suite AND it was ready! After the horrible treatment we had from our last hotel (Hotel Costes, K: feel free to read my review) this almost made me cry, I was so thankful. Check-in staff was friendly, polite and informative. We found that all the staff that we ran into during the course of our stay was just as pleasant. The room we received was huge! It had a separate living room with full-size sofa bed & 2 chairs, a long buffet/desk and even a fold out dining table. The bedroom was large, bed was comfortable and it had a spectacular city view with a cute little balcony with table & chairs. Bathroom was very spacious, clean and with all mod cons including a separate toilet room. Being American, I’m used to larger hotel rooms, but here in the middle of the night, I was a little lost finding my way to the loo! Huge closet – although it was located in the living room. Safe and mini fridge was nice. The business center was very small – the size of a phone booth, but I was glad that they at least had one as we left the laptop at home. We didn’t try the restaurant unfortunately, so I can’t comment about that. As reported by previous reviewers, the only con was the proximity to the metro. I live in the city and am used to the usual city noises, but although the metro in itself was not all that loud, it was the shaking that concerned me most - especially being from So. California where any type of building shaking is not good! The shaking caused some rattling noises, which by the second night we pinpointed were coming from the balcony furniture & teapot. After moving these around a bit, the rattling stopped. Still, the shaking did wake me up a couple of times during the night. Had it not been for this, I believe that this hotel would be most excellent and very worth the price. Clean & comfortable rooms, efficient & polite service and charming and desirable location. A bit of warning: We went to the restaurant directly below the hotel and were insanely overcharged for beverages (15 E or $22, one glass of warm water 9.5 E or $14.25; and one glass of table wine 16.5 E or $33). To add injury to insult, we became sick from the food (roasted chicken) for the rest of the night and into the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But Be Warned If You Plan to Stay on a Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in the Richepanse for four nights in early June. The location is excellent - very close to most of the major attractions in Paris. Our room was clean and comfortable, with a good sized bathroom. In addition, the front desk staff were more than accommodating, pleasant and helpful, especially by suffering through my atrocious French. However, the noise from the Metro station was significant, and most disturbingly, the street noise was intolerable on the nights when the young Parisians were out to party. There is a nightclub just around the corner of the hotel, and the club didn't close until 5:30am! On Saturday night, there were literally dozens drunken people that staggered down the street in front of the hotel to catch the Metro until the nightclub closed at 5:30am. We were unable to sleep at all that night, as huge numbers of people were yelling, breaking bottles, fighting and even urinating against the walls of the buildings opposite the hotel. At one point as we watched several young people involved in a particularly violent altercation, I was truly frightened, and it felt like we were witnessing a riot. When we questioned the desk clerk about the noise, this appeared to be a common occurrance. So if you are staying over a Friday or Saturday night, be aware that you may not sleep much! In addition, the hotel is difficult for taxi drivers to find as the street name (Rue de Chevelier de St. George) seems to also be known as Richepanse on some of the older maps. So while we thought that this hotel had many great things going for it, was certainly reasonably priced, and in a fantastic location, we cannot recommend it to other travellers if you are staying over a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Opera Richepanse back in October 2005 and had a very pleasant stay. The rooms were very tidy and clean, the bathroom was rather small and the shower head was not adjustable, though. Some reviews noted some noise caused by the subway running under the hotel. Yes, there is a slight rumble every 30 minutes or so, but we found it only little distractive or annoying. The staff was extremely cordial and helpful and everyone (including the night porter) had very good command of the English language. The only (minor) drawback was the fact that the hotel didn't feature a wireless internet access, as it has become pretty much the standard in 3+ star hotels in Paris. The hotel's location is great and perfect for short-time breaks, as most attractions are within walking distance, this includes Place de la Concorde, Louvre, Les Halles, Place Vendome, Jardin des Tuileries, L'Opera and Champs Elysées - all reachable by foot within 5 to 20 minutes. We definitely will return to the Opera Richepance when we are going to visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel from the Best Western Pergolese as it was "oversold." We wanted the Pergolese as the reviews we saw said it was reasonably quiet. After I explained to the management that I chose the Pergolese beause it was quiet, we got moved to an upper floor at the Opera Richepanse. This helped, but you could still hear the Metro under the hotel. Overall, however, I think that the hotel is fantastic - the staff, the location, the cleanliness and upkeep were all top notch. These vastly outshined any noise from outside the hotel. Yes our stay was still a bit noisy, but welcome to Paris. If you are coming to Paris and are a light sleeper, bring your earplugs and be prepared to pay for a room on the top floor of your hotel because I believe that no hotel in Paris can guarantee a noiseless stay. Just relax and enjoy what the city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - BUT”
Reviews.Author: sussexali
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in March 2006. Very helpful and pleasant staff. Hotel location is fantastic, 2 minutes to Madeline tube. Good restaurants nearby especially the Madeline 7 (5 minutes walk), excellent fois gras (menu 27 euros). Hotel itself extremely noisy - tube noise and traffic day and night. No bar in the hotel and mini bar only restocked once in our 3 night stay! Fine as a place to crash but don't pay too much for this hotel.
